description: No problem adding single files or folder for me while using Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS. Used this years ago with earlier versons of Ubuntu with no issues. I give it five star because it does what it says, plays music.
Looks great and modern while getting out of your way with enough basic features.
Amazing job, it's really nice to see what GTK4 can do

Best UI I've seen in a Linux native app by far, definitely the best music playing experience you can get if you appreciate simplicity. Its just that some of my music library doesnt play here, so I use celluloid as well. Also you cant rearrange the playlist during a session.
But overall a good app
I can't play .ogg files.
summary: Pretty good and nice-looking music player. There's one problem though

description: The app needs to be debugged
summary: The app fails to play music, Flatpak version recommended

description: The app starts but doesn't allow me to load folders
nice inteface but no drag & drop
What else could you for in a simple music player application.
It's a very simple music app, it's fast and looks nice. But it has an enormous UI that doesn't even fit on my 1366x768 laptop screen. Not everyone has a 4K monitor...
summary: Takes way too much screen space

description: love this music player

Yes, it's a different approach to listening music. But this is a grand example that different doesn't always translate to great. Or even to good. Tedious concept to handle music like this from your large library.
Lack many options; occupy a large space of the display. But more importantly for me: does not make it easier to find music.
Clean, minimalistic and modern
summary: The most beautiful music player for GNOME

description:
Cannot add music folder. Clicking 'Choose a folder' button > selecting a folder > clicking 'Add folder' does nothing.

This app is broken and cannot be used to play music.
summary: It cannot play music from my music folder

description: It's crazy how pleasure it is to use Amberol!
summary: You got me - I am converting my spotify library to mp3!

description:
Very beautiful app.

Huge thanks to the developer for their time and effort to build and share this app with the world.
update + Live

This music player fits perfectly with the GNOME 42. I love that it's kept super simple and clean, but it's missing a few basic features in my opinion:
1) Static theme (System default, Light, Dark)
2) Be able to remember the chosen music folder(s) instead of asking the user to choose a folder every time it is launched.
3) Playlist view and/or folder view
4) The ability to recognize playlist files (m3u, m3u8...) so it'll create the list of playlists automatically
I don't need a library or something to organize my songs since I just manage them through the file manager, I only need an app that looks nice and play music, so Amberol is perfect for me! ??
This must be one of the best music apps I've tried! Love it!

It's a nice app even though it's in some sort of beta at the moment of writing this review.It's very minimal yet so stunnig and efficient. This app is literally the only thing you'll ever need for a desktop flex(posting your linux destop online).
Application looks amazing. Would be great is it had search.

Just plays your music. That's it, oh and also looks good.
Doesn't manage your music library, doesn't support podcasts or internet radio, doesn't connect to Spotify/SoundCloud etc., doesn't connect to Fast.fm or Libre.fm, but it doesn't want to anyway.
If you only want to play a playlist, this app is great, if you want anything more, go use Lollypop/Rhythmbox/Audacious/...
Very minimal yet intuitive and beautiful UI. Would be perfect if there was a way to create and save playlists in the future.

The application looks incredible, it really does look as good as the screenshots. The functionality does not quite reach the same bar but I am sure this will come in time. Try it out and have a tasty slice of the desktop of the future, even if the cream is not quite rich enough yet.
summary: Great looks, a bit basic in functionality

description: This is just what I needed. A simple app that I can use to play my Video Game Soundtracks. There's no library management or any other unneeded features. It's clean and ridiculously easy to use. It also looks fantastic! Highly recommended.
summary: Finally! A simple and easy to use music player!

description: Simple, works great. Reminds me of WinAmp back in the day!
Since GNOME Music can't play music files that aren't scanned to the library this is a good app for just listening to audio files
summary: Equivalent to the Image Viewer app

description:
A nice and simple music player.
Hope it evolves in the future.

Thanks to the author.
This is one of my favorite app designs I've seen period.
summary: Beautiful little player, does what it's supposed to

description: good app, my only wish is an album or artist menu. or atleast let me search my music
summary: decent, but it needs a little more work

description: I wish my wishes developers can hear ... I love beautiful music visualizer I hope this feature also in upcoming update ...

As all new generation Gnome apps, the UI is great. 
I understand its a 'simple' music player but lacking the ability to create and store playlists? 
Too simple for my use. I'd rather stick to file preview if I'm just going to listen to music. If it gets more abilities in the future, will try again for sure. 
For now, hats off and thank you to the dev for introducing a new UI perspective to FLOSS music players .
summary: Good design but not very practical

description: Minimalistic, clean, fast and convinient.
Does look good, plays music. Do not have expectations of anything else.
summary: no (extra) functionality, does one thing right - play music

description:
I'm tired of choosing a folder for every app launch
Also it would be nice if it could work in the background as well
summary: I wish it gave me the option to load a default music folder

description: This is the kind of music player I've always wanted on linux. Clean, simple yet beautiful ui.
summary: Great app with a Beautiful and clean ui

description: I'm very impressed by the simplicity of this application. I'm not keen on the recent addition of a little icon badge in the top left corner though. Less is more. Feature bloat and bells and whistles are not what I'm looking for.
It's a nice app, simple, responsive and very modern. Hope the evolution in the future will be great!

looks great, but does not run on pinephone yet.
imediately crashes on startup (manjaro, kde)
Love the simplicity, and love how it looks and works. Solid app
pressing space should pause/resume playback, not open some random menu
Fast, clean and powerful enough to just listen musics. That's the player I've looking for so long.
summary: Great app, top music player on the store

description:
I love this! It's simple, doesn't try to organize my entire disk or insist on some arbitrary limitation, lets me play my music, gets out of the way, and is beautiful to boot.
No knock on other players, I'm just the perfect target audience for this one.
An option to automatically download your YouTube playlists should be added. Other than that, perfect music player.
summary: Great app, but could be improved

description: clean and beautiful UI. This is not intended to replace a fully fledged audio player but for it's intended purpose it works great. I find myself using it more and more.
For some unfathomable reason, i can't open this app from menu. Only from the gnome software store. And when i did it, the app forgets that i have already opened it before. . . why? how?

It's not what I was expecting. It is only a music player, and you need to add the songs you want to play every time you open it.
It looks very nice and might be what you're looking for but it's not for me.
Really like the design philosophy of this app as it is very simple with a great looking UI
Wow, the sound quality is just absolutely awesome..simple, no bells n whistles, but does the job really well.
summary: Does exactly what it say - plays music well..thx!

description: nothing else is even close.

this is the perfact one, that i need for offline music.
So simple .

Amberol has quickly became my favourite music player. It's simple and beatiful, I use it almost every day to listen to my music. My only complaint is that there should be a way to add a default music folder to open on launch, and a less hidden way to quit the program entirely (or add a system tray icon so it's easier to understand when it's on..?). Other than that - it's fantastic.
As the tittle suggests
summary: Add a large folder (12gb+) and it dies

description: Cannot recognise .wav files as music files. Useless.
simple, super easy to use, just the right amount of features.
summary: does one thing and does it well

description: Due to the lack of background play daemon, this app is worth trying.

I was getting pretty tired of music players that tried to manage my music for me inevitably borking up several hundred tags. Rhythmbox isn't bad functionally but it is pretty ugly and the GTK theme wouldn't swtich between light/dark mode. Amberol looks nice and plays music. That's it. And frankly it's all I want right now. A little more customization on the UI/colors would be nice.
summary: Does exactly what it says on the tin. Just perfect

description: Awesome App, Great Usability and stunning Design! But if you load a big Folder of Music into the queue all of the Songs will be load into Memory instead of the next 15 Songs for example. Maybe I am wrong and it will automatically load less into Memory on lower end systems.
summary: Makes Listening to Music more fun unless you dont have much RAM

description: Amberol doesn't do a lot, and that's what makes it so great! You simply select a folder and play the files within it. It even works recursively, so I can play all my lo-fi music at once. It looks stunning, integrates well with my GNOME desktop and has just the right amount of configurability. I really like that it shows how much is left of the queue.
summary: The best looking music player for Linux right now

description: very supper interface

It acts like it will open a file or folder. Files alone doesn't work from the app, or from GNOME Files manager. App is very minimalistic but has a rather tall minimum height. As is I can't recommend it.
Considering you can make the background match the cover art, it's kind of a big deal that I can't change it... In your next update, please add the ability to change cover art of Music.
summary: The app is great, but needs the ability to change cover art

description: just use audacious
Does what it says it does. Does it well. Prety simple. Looks elegant. Nice.

This music player is amazingly simple. It is so simple, that on Fedora Silverblue 37, it forgets your music library each time you close the app. It would be perfectly fine if it were to retain my music library, but I cannot recommend it unless this is fixed.
Very good, very simple, very effective
i like this app, one missing thing: an equalizer

This app just outright refuses to detect some of my music files. Even when manually adding certain songs and folders, I get a "no songs found" notice. Every other player I've tried works fine, so I don't know why it's a problem here.
I can't go back to fancy music players that organize your library and everything after using this. It's simple and beautiful. Love it.
It does what it says, just plays music, be it files or a folder. The only thing I miss is being able to open .m3u playlists, and save them naitvely.
it is bang average...needs so much polishing.
summary: Do i like have to add the folder everytime i open the app?

description: Search is so slow that I gave up and uninstalled before even finding out whether it can play my wma files
This is favorite music app it's very good I know it's meant to be simple but I'd love for it to display lyrics other than that its amazing.
Today's update wont start on the Librem5 (april 24th).
This player is just great.
summary: One of the best and clean music player in linux universe

description: If I had to design a music player, it would be this. This fits so well with my design tastes, thank you so much!
If you are looking for a clean, fast, beautiful, and basic music player, this is the application for you.	It's a great example of the UNIX philosophy at work.
summary: Beautiful, and does what it needs to do

description: Does one thing and does it in style.
bag on ui please make it

Hopefully the author adds in the future some additional features like equializer, themes etc... 
But already a good app !
Thank you for your effort.
I am using Amberol to test-listen to my album, and it's been great. The UI is very pretty and it just works. I have had 0 issues and it is very easy to use. 10/10 job guys, keep up the amazing work!
Simple and beautiful no-nonsense music player

but not so convenient in a day to day usecase. I expected to have a small and fast player just to open and listen to a single music file and check it out, but there is to much friction and user action involved to use it as such.
Plays even the heaviest lossless file without a hitch. My complain is that album art stays small even when window is maximized, wish it looked bigger.
summary: Love it for the most part

description:
keyboard shortcuts is all messed up it should use space to play/pause arrow to forward backward up down to next previous etc.
ctrl+ something is totally unnecesarry
please change that or give option to change that.
summary: looks great and play music in background

description: Awesome app, have files, will play. Perfect for me.
perfect and nice
Good app, works great
Only think missing is ability to scrobble to last.fm to make it a five star app
Love it. I have a playlist with 40GB amd its fast and responsive.
doesn't want to play my Wave files.
just love it simple & soft
Great simple music player. I think I'm used to programs that do one thing great and not several that are just ok. Great job to the developer.
there is a problem. When I play my music (with no metadata) it plays the music but it doesn't show the file name. Instead, it says 'Unknown Track' and 'Unknown Artist'
It did everything I wanted it to, and more.
Simple, beautiful and musical.

This app works good for playing music with a good set of features. A feature I love is the separate volume control which allows me to lower the volume of playing music while another program is also playing audio at the louder system set level.
which makes the b-side of abbey road unlistenable.

I was looking for an handy music player ot play my mp3-files. For that purpose it's perfect. 
More then that it has great desingt and all functions of a good player like mix tracks or repeat are available. Congrats to developers on that player!
summary: For me the best music player at the moment

description: ...sehr guter und einfacher Audio-Player!!

It does what it says on the tin : It just plays music.
Ive tried tons of music players, going from the 90's super boring looking one to the huge confusing gasfactory one.
This one does perfectly the job, and is both modern, simple, beautiful and elegant. What's not to love ?
summary: A wonderfully simple and beautiful music player

description: Does exactly what it says, playing music, nothing else. The best part: It doesn't look like software from the 20th century!

Great player, looking good!
The developer is fast in answering questions and very helpful.
Amazing work.
Doesn't support Playlists, or even changing music sorting.
Clean, simple, but pretty UI and has the features I'd have expected it to have.
summary: Does what it is told gracefully

description: Looks nice and does what it has to do.
As I keep all my media files on a network share I need SMB support. Unfortuanlety this app dosen't work with SMB.
summary: Does not work with SMB share

description:
First of all I want to tell you that you work is absolutely amazig and I use Amberol as my default music player since I installed Fedora.
One thing that annoys me: whenever I just want to hear random music, it gets added to my playlist which I don't want, so maybe add an option which disables new music from joining the playlist.

The design is minimal and beautiful at the same time, and the usage is "EZPZ" 
Would give 5/5 if the option was added
En lo personal, es de las mejores aplicaciones para escuchar musica.
es todo lo que buscaba en un reproductor felicitaciones!
El reproductor más bonito de todos los sistemas operativos

Hermosa app para reproducir música o archivos de audio. 
Es minimalista y solo pretende cumplir con lo básico. Muy bien diseñada. 
La versión Flathub (Flatpak) funciona perfecto.
Perfecto ,ligero hace lo que debe y muy bien ,sin ventanas pesadas y todo ligero perfecto.
Perfecto reproductor, tiene lo que se precisa, simple, rápido, moderno
A veces, menos es mas.
Justo lo que buscaba. Sencilla y bonita.

Soy de preferir reproductores de musica complejos como puede ser Musicbee en Windows pero Amberol tiene un encanto particular, va muuy fluido, es rapido, personalmente le falta trabajo pero lo que esta viene bien además luce bastante bonito.
simple pero de calidad.

Simple, pero es suficiente para lo que necesito.

Probado en Ubuntu 23.04
funcionando en Ubuntu 22.04. pocos recursos ideal para escuchar reproduciendo en segundo plano.
Mucho se ha dicho sobre que menos es más, pero esta aplicación lo vuelve realidad, con una estética brutal y una fluidez tremenda. Se ha ganado un puesto en mis aplicaciones favoritas.
Simple pero eficiente, muy bueno.
Una interface simple, pero efectiva, para los que no queremos más que un reproductor. Quizá le falta alguna función.
Sin duda un excelente reproductor, cumple con lo que tiene que cumplir y además tiene una excelente interfaz
Es muy chulo y va muy bien.
Súper simple y práctico, además de rápido y bonito. Es verdad que no le vendría mal una vista de biblioteca más completa, pero para lo que es, es excelente.
Good app ! But you must disable the Gnome Shell Extension "Media Progress" becaause it creates bugs and slowdown in the whole system.
top !top !top !top !top !

Je n'ai pas réussi à lancer l'application, en y intégrant mes dossiers de musique les uns après les autres, l'application plante et s'éteint. Quand je la redémarre, les dossiers que j'ai réussi à intégrer sont oubliés et il faut tout recommencer...

There are missing features tho:
ability to save current playlist
rearanging songs (dragging them would be more useful than moving the window)
Je cherchais un lecteur de musique. Quand je suis tombé sur celui-ci, j'ai arrêté de chercher. J'ai oublié tout ce que j'avais déjà essayé, et j'ai adopté celui-ci. Je le trouve pas mal.
Cool , j'écoute mes musique avec style mais le problème c'est qu'il n'y a pas de thème sombre mais pas grave elle est parfaite
Супер простой плеер, даже слишком. Не хватает полосы прокрутки и эквалайзера. А главное закрытие в трей.
summary: Для начала неплохо. Главное не забросить

description: хороший звук и ничего лишнего
Ничего лишнего. Выполняет свои функции на 100%.
Уже столько обнов было, а выбранный каталог не сохряняет.
Звук очень хороший.
Классный плеер, один из лучших на Linux, простой и минималистичный. Желаю удачи в развитии!)

Первое преимущество, что могу отметить — минималистичный дизайн, в арсенале базовые настройки, всё, что нужно для прослушивания песен. Собственно по дизайну это вообще лучшее приложение, он чуть ли не интуитивный.
Качество проигрывания — стандартное, как и у стандартных программ, типа Rhythmbox. Можно создавать очереди произведения, повторять песню или альбом. В общем, если вы искали простенькое приложение для прослушивания, то Amberol — отличный выбор!
самое высокое качество звука
I like it! Linux needs more apps like that!
минус - огда открываешь каждый раз приходится выбирать папку

Невероятный проигрыватель. Минималистичный. Красивый. Отлично вписывается в интерфейс Gnome 43. Я пробовал Rhytmbox и Lollypop, но даже не думал, что это так трудно просто слушать файлы из конкретной папки, а тут все просто. Мое уважение тем, кто это сделал.
То, чего так не хватало на Ubuntu!
Очень хороший плеер. Современный дизайн.
Все устраивает, советую
Звук хороший, список воспроизведения не сохраняет, открывает папку или файл, может так и лучше. Настроек практически никаких. Включил открыл папку и слушай. Оформление стильное.

Интерфейс лучший, который я видел. Минималистичный, современный, ОТОБРАЖАЕТ обложки в отличии от некоторых, ФОН ПОДСТРАИВАЕТ ПОД ЦВЕТА ОБЛОЖКИ, квадратное соотношение.
Этот плеер ещё бы на Windows.
summary: Просто ЛУЧШИЙ интерфейс! Хотелось бы это плеер ещё и на Windows

description: Love its design and minimalism, thank you!
Does not start after the last update
Выглядит современно! Буду пользоваться.
It's realy best!
То что нужно, ни чего лишнего
Отличный простой плеер без всяких дополнений. Просто выбрал папку с музыкой и играет. Приятный внешний вид.
То что нужно. Приложение не перегружено функционалом.

Минималистично, удобно, красиво.

Визуально привычнее для пользователей смартофонов. 

Странно, что это не базовое приложение для музыки.
хорошее качество звука.
Красивый, минимилистичный и хорошее качество звука. Может работать в фоне
ui明快，可惜功能还是少过头了，关闭播放器就得重新导入歌曲未免太麻烦
确实是一个没有宏伟妄想的音乐播放器，只能播放本地文件夹中的音乐，没有播放samba文件夹中的音乐
summary: 没法播放samba文件夹中的音乐

description: 个人觉得比ubuntu自带的要好，界面更美观简洁！
